info.description: Retrieve, update, and transition Workflow items as surfaced in Risk Radar.
info.title: Risk Governance - Workflows

get.description: Retrieve a list of Workflow items matching the search parameters provided

parameters.description: A unique identifier for this request.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID

parameters.description: Timestamp assigned to this request at origin, in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Origin-Timestamp

parameters.description:
A list of workflow states used to filter returned workflow items.
If parameter value is not provided, only workflow items with non-terminal states will be returned.
If terminal states are provided and the begin range time is not provided, the workflow 
items returned for these states will be restricted to a lookback period of 45 days.
(-- api-linter: core::0132::request-unknown-fields=disabled aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is existing field and we are deprecating these to remove in future --).
parameters.name: workflowStates

parameters.description:
A list of workflow ids to be searched for
(-- api-linter: core::0132::request-unknown-fields=disabled aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is existing field and we are deprecating these to remove in future --).
parameters.name: workflowIds

parameters.description:
The users whom a workflow item (task) is assigned to
(-- api-linter: core::0132::request-unknown-fields=disabled aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is existing field and we are deprecating these to remove in future --).
parameters.name: assignee

parameters.description:
The start date and time from which to apply the provided search parameters
(-- api-linter: core::0132::request-unknown-fields=disabled aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we have time series and this will provide a way to filter out based on time --).
parameters.name: beginRangeTime

parameters.description:
The end date and time to which to apply the provided search parameters
(-- api-linter: core::0132::request-unknown-fields=disabled aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we have time series and this will provide a way to filter out based on time --).
parameters.name: endRangeTime

parameters.description:
Used to provide filtering capabilities on workflow results
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because it is generic field to support filtering capabilities under aip https://google.aip.dev/160 --).
parameters.name: filter

post.description:
Retrieve the history of all activities performed against workflow items or all workflows associated with a given set of exceptions over the last 12 months
(--api-linter: aladdin::9050::rpc-name=disabled aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we need a batch end point to pull history/revisions for multiple workflows in one go. This helps citizen developers to pull history in one request instead of looping through end point for the single workflow id --)

Any.description:
`Any` contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a
URL that describes the type of the serialized message

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized message.

rpcStatus.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

requests.description: Risk workflows record being submitted to create a workflow.

v1BatchCreateRiskWorkflowsResponse.title: Response object for batch create workflow endpoint

v1BatchListRiskWorkflowsRevisionsRequest.title:
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9050::request-ids-field=disabled aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we have two flavours of requests here --)
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9050::request-unknown-fields=disabled aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we have two flavours of requests here --)
The request message for retreiving Revision history for multiple workflow ids or exceptions ids

v1BatchListRiskWorkflowsRevisionsRespons.title:
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9050::response-results-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because No guidanance on how to pull audit/history/revision for multiple resource in one request --)
The revision history for multiple workflow ids or exceptions ids

results.title: List of histories for the requested workflow/exception ids

v1BatchUpdateRiskWorkflowsRequest.title:
Message carrying the new Workflow Items to be initiated 
(-- api-linter: core::0234::request-requests-field=disabled aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because the field already exsists --)

requests.title: The Worflow Items the be created

workflowItems.title: A list of Worflows successfully updated

error.description: The error result of the operation in case of failure or cancellation.

output.description: The normal response of the operation in case of success.

v1ExecuteRiskWorkflowRequest.description: Message carring the Workflow Activities to be executed.

workflowActivityItems.description: The Worflow Items the be created.

v1ExecuteRiskWorkflowResponse.title: Response of the post Workflow Items initialization

workflowItems.title: A list of Worflows successfully executed

v1ListRiskWorkflowRevisionsResponse.title: History response for the given workflow id

nextPageToken.title: next page token in case of paginated response

v1ListRiskWorkflowsResponse.title:
Response from the Risk Governance list Workflows endpoint 
(-- api-linter: core::0158::response-next-page-token-field=disabled aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because is irrelevant at this context --)

workflowItems.title: A map of workflows items mapped by workflow id

count.title: The number of entries returned with the current response

total.title: The number of entries matching the specified criterias at the repository

v1LongrunningOperation.description:
LongrunningOperation represents a long-running operation that is the result
of a network API call.

id.description:
The server-assigned id, which is only unique within the same service that
originally returns it. If you use the default HTTP mapping, the
`id` should have the format of `operations/some/unique/id`.

meta.description:
Service-specific metadata associated with the operation.  It typically
contains progress information and common metadata such as create time.
Some services might not provide such metadata.  Any method that returns a
long-running operation should document the metadata type, if any.

done.description:
If the value is `false`, it means the operation is still in progress.
If true, the operation is completed, and either `error` or `response` is
available.

error.description: The error result of the operation in case of failure or cancellation.

response.description:
The normal response of the operation in case of success.  If the original
method returns no data on success, such as `Delete`, the response is
`google.protobuf.Empty`.  If the original method is standard
`Get`/`Create`/`Update`, the response should be the resource.  For other
methods, the response should have the type `XxxResponse`, where `Xxx`
is the original method name.  For example, if the original method name
is `TakeSnapshot()`, the inferred response type is
`TakeSnapshotResponse`.

workflowItems.title: List of RiskWorkflow items matching the specified workflow ids

workflowActivity.title: The abstraction of an activity related to a workflow

workflowDescription.title: The description privided to give context to this item

workflowPriority.title: The priority scale for given to this task

workflowFailureMessage.title: Failure messages related to this item

workflowAvailableActions.title: The next allowd steps for this item

ruleId.title: The ID of the Rule associated with this workflow item

scopeId.title:
The unique scope identifier of the exception associated to this workflow item. E.g. for a portfolio, this should be the portfolio code
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is an existing attribute in risk_exception.proto and has to be same --)

scopeType.title: The scope type of the exception associated with this workflow item e.g. one of 'GLOBAL', 'PORTFOLIO_GROUP', 'PORTFOLIO', 'OTHER'

workflowAssignee.title: The user to who a workflow item (task) is assigned to

workflowComment.title: A comment placed by a user

workflowAction.title: The action taken on this item

workflowState.title: The state of this particular item, e.g. In Review

workflowResolutionCategoryKey.title:
The key of the workflow resolution category, which maps onto the Resolution Category definition configured in the system
(-- aip.dev/beta-blocker: see if there is a way to add the type association for a filtered resource --)

workflowResolutionKey.title:
The key of the workflow resolution, which maps onto the Resolution definition configured in the system
(-- aip.dev/beta-blocker: see if there is a way to add the type association for a filtered resource --)

modifier.title: Identifies the modifier that performed the activity

modifyTime.title: The time the workflow activity was performed

createTime.title: The time the underlying workflow item was created

dueDate.title:
The date by which the current workflow state should be actioned
(-- api-linter: core::0142::time-field-type=disabled aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because due date is the more natural term the business would use to describe this--)
(-- api-linter: core::0142::time-field-names=disabled aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because due date is the more natural term the business would use to describe this --)

v1RiskWorkflowPriority.description:
- RISK_WORKFLOW_PRIORITY_UNSPECIFIED: No definition present
 - RISK_WORKFLOW_PRIORITY_HIGH: The item has been identified as a high priority actionable task
 - RISK_WORKFLOW_PRIORITY_MEDIUM: The item has been identified as a medium priority actionable task
 - RISK_WORKFLOW_PRIORITY_LOW: The item has been identified as a low priority actionable task
v1RiskWorkflowPriority.title: Priority scale for Risk Governance Workflow Items

workflowActivities.title: The abstraction of an activity related to a workflow

workflowDescription.title: The description privided to give context to this item

workflowPriority.title: The priority scale for given to this task

ruleId.title: The ID of the Rule associated with this workflow item

scopeId.title:
The unique scope identifier of the exception associated to this workflow item. E.g. for a portfolio, this should be the portfolio code
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is an existing attribute in risk_exception.proto and has to be same --)

scopeType.title: The scope type of the exception associated with this workflow item e.g. one of 'GLOBAL', 'PORTFOLIO_GROUP', 'PORTFOLIO', 'OTHER'

v1RiskWorkflowsMetaData.title:
Metadata for batch create long running operation
Currently it is not possible to determine progress, but it may be possible in the future

v1RiskWorkflowsRevisionsMetaData.title:
Metadata for longrunning operation
Currently it is not possible to determine progress, but it may be possible in the future

v1UpdateRiskWorkflowActivityRequest.title: Message carring the new Worflow Items to be initiated

riskWorkflowActivity.title: The Worflow Items the be created

updateMask.description: The list of fields to be updated.

OAuth2AccessCode.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the access code flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.

OAuth2ClientCredentials.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the client credentials flow.
